title: Polygon import float values give problems while editing
body:
When importing data Diffgram allows for floats in polygons.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1612886/174499057-de4f9aa2-765e-48fc-9006-9b88112b7c4e.png)



These labels all show up perfectly fine, except you can't edit them!
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1612886/174499098-af5b0d92-fe06-47bb-bb9c-396c2336702c.png)

Version used is 0.15.0, but the check is still the same in latest master branch.

[https://github.com/diffgram/diffgram/blob/master/shared/regular/regular_input.py](https://github.com/diffgram/diffgram/blob/master/shared/regular/regular_input.py)

I don't know what the right fix for this would be. Maybe don't allow float polygon inputs, but that wouldn't be user friendly. So converting them at import time (and notifying the user that floats will be converted to int) seems like a reasonable idea. Also I don't know what other potential problems this could give for people that already have a lot of data uploaded with floats in their polygons.

Edit:
Exporting a dataset with float polygons works just fine, you just can't edit them.
